description.value:
Dragonborn are &reference[humanoid] lizards with the blood of dragons running through their veins. In some settings, they are directly descendants of dragons in some way, and in some settings they are created magically by draconic gods. Dragonborn can also refer to half-dragons, the humanoid lizard-like offspring created when a &reference[dragon], shapeshifted into a mortal, produces offspring with a mortal. Dragonborn often have heads resembling the dragon corresponding to their color.

Type: &reference[Dragon]{Dragon}

Size: Medium

Walking Speed: 30 ft.

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Language}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID.JournalEntryPage.XKDt41tEzeqkLzvu#draconic]{Draconic}

Senses: &Reference[Darkvision] 60 ft.

Damage Resistance: &Reference[Lightning]

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-ancestries.Item.uASHr7i5VQsvVxPA]{Breath Weapon}

In the world of Elkan, young dragonborn are injected with the blood of dragons when they are born, transforming them into magical creatures. Those without draconic ancestry almost never survive. After this process, dragonborn belong to a 'Bloodline', corresponding to the color of the &reference[dragon] whose blood awakened them. The chromatic dragons- the red, blue, green, white, and black dragons- forcibly control their dragonborn servants. Belonging to one of the chromatic bloodlines means that you likely had to escape. The metallic dragons- the gold, silver, bronze, brass, and copper dragons- are more benevolent and allow dissatisfied dragonborn to venture into the world.

Regardless, joining a Bloodline means you are unable to join another (trying would kill you), and you will forever have impulses to act similarly to the personalities of your Bloodlines. While you can control these impulses, it is a lifelong struggle.

The blue dragons of Elkan live in the Sands of Nad, where they compete with each other for fame and status. They enjoy wielding their power over lesser creatures to mock or even ruin them. Members of the Blue Bloodline feel an intrusive desire to force weaker creatures to do things against their will.
